body_html: My team fixed it on our side. Now I have reason to believe that TF is messing with the pointers I am returning from my custom allocator which are actually pointers to structures that control the hardware. It seems that the pointers are getting used within Buffer and then the Buffer tries to free them as if they were a float pointer which causes a SegFault. Is this something that might happen? How can I fix it?

body: My team fixed it on our side. Now I have reason to believe that TF is messing with the pointers I am returning from my custom allocator which are actually pointers to structures that control the hardware. It seems that the pointers are getting used within [Buffer](https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/blob/master/tensorflow/core/framework/tensor.cc#L87) and then the Buffer tries to free them as if they were a float pointer which causes a SegFault. Is this something that might happen? How can I fix it?
